title: Application of Item Response Theory (IRT) to Improve Online Course Assessment Quality [K-12]

context.prior_knowledge: Basic physics knowledge and online learning experience
context.additional_context: An intensive short-term course for beginner science learners to study IRT-based assessment design and quality validation methods

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of Item Response Theory (IRT) and assessment quality indicators (validity, reliability, fairness)
Learners can design IRT-based assessment items in LMS environments and perform procedures to analyze difficulty consistency
Learners can visualize changes in item-wise correct answer rates via graphs from science assessment data measured ≥3 times and identify ≥2 items with ≥10% differences for reporting.

resources: IRT (Item Response Theory) Analysis Software (e.g., R, IRTPRO)
AP Physics Equivalent Assessment Item Sample Set

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
